H0.text: Fire is the change most likely to be slow among changes that can be fast or slow.

H1.text: Flood is the most likely slowest change among the given changes, as some changes occur rapidly while others occur slowly.

H2.text: Landslide is the most likely slowest change among changes that can be fast or slow.

H3.text: Drought is the change that is most likely the slowest among changes that can be fast or slow.

A4.text: Fire became more abundant when grasses became the dominant component of many ecosystems, around 6 to 7 million years ago, providing excellent tinder for more rapid spread of fire.

A5.text: Clay and silt slides are usually slow but can experience episodic acceleration in response to heavy rainfall or rapid snowmelt.

A6.text: Earthflows are more slow-moving and are covered with solid material carried along by the flow from within.
